Sentencas: The kinetic Monte Carlo technique was employed to simulate an entire solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) during operation to gain insight into the electrode kinetics and rate-limiting steps in the intermediate temperature range.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: By combining the quantum simulation studies of oxide ion migration in the fuel cell electrolyte with the experimental studies of the cathode and anode reaction rates, a complete SOFC can be modeled.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: To study the effect of triple phase boundaries and the size of the catalyst, simulations were performed for different sizes of Pt clusters on the electrolyte surface.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The results confirm that the charge-transfer reaction rates depend on the catalyst size.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The fuel cell with smaller catalyst particles produces higher power density as expected.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The reaction rates of each process were recorded as a function of time.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The overpotentials were subsequently determined as a function of catalyst size.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The results show that oxygen adsorption is the slowest step on the cathode, while water formation is the slowest step on the anode.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The methodology can be used to optimize the catalyst size on both electrodes to reduce the activation loss in intermediate temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Kinetic Monte Carlo Simulations of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
